meanings.definition: Lose consciousness for a short time because of a temporarily insufficient supply of oxygen to the brain.
meanings.sent1: She faints when she sees blood.
meanings.sent2: He faints easily in hot weather.
meanings.sent3: The sight of a spider makes her faint.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat made him feel like he would faint.
meanings.sent5: The lack of air in the stuffy room caused her to faint.

meanings.sent1: After running for a long time, she faints from exhaustion.
meanings.sent2: He faints whenever he stands up too quickly.
meanings.sent3: The thought of heights makes her faint-hearted.
meanings.sent4: The overwhelming news made him faint with shock.
meanings.sent5: The strong smell of the chemicals made her faint and nauseous.

meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the causes of her faints.
meanings.sent3: His dramatic faints always draw attention.
meanings.sent4: The sudden faints at the party caused a commotion.
meanings.sent5: The frequency of her faints raised concerns among her friends.
